page.title: 08Birds, fish and amphibians.
page.content: Many water birds use the Tarn. Coots are always present. In winter and early spring when there is less disturbance from boats, swans, tufted duck, Widgeon and poachers can be seen. Rare visitors include great Northern diver and Black tern. Dippers are fairly frequent along the Gelt and by the Tarn. Tawny and Barn owls are widespread. Green woodpeckers and jays are seen occasionally and woodland birds include goldcrest and wood warbler. In the open country, kestrels are common, curlew and lapwing are present and recently a hen harrier has been spotted. Gold finches and Fieldfares visit the gardens. Jackdaws are common around the houses. In the Tarn there are perch,pike,eel and chub. Toads, frogs, newts and lizards are common and there is a rare water beetle in the Tarn.
